info.description:
# Introduction

Samsara provides API endpoints for interacting with Samsara Cloud, so that you can build powerful applications and custom solutions with sensor data. Samsara has endpoints available to track and analyze sensors, vehicles, and entire fleets.

The Samsara Cloud API is a [RESTful API](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) accessed by an [HTTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol) client such as wget or curl, or HTTP libraries of most modern programming languages including python, ruby, java. We use built-in HTTP features, like HTTP authentication and HTTP verbs, which are understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients. We allow you to interact securely with our API from a client-side web application (though you should never expose your secret API key). [JSON](http://www.json.org/) is returned by all API responses, including errors. If you’re familiar with what you can build with a REST API, the following API reference guide will be your go-to resource.

API access to the Samsara cloud is available to all Samsara administrators. To start developing with Samsara APIs you will need to [obtain your API keys](#section/Authentication) to authenticate your API requests.

If you have any questions you can reach out to us on [support@samsara.com](mailto:support@samsara.com)

# Endpoints

All our APIs can be accessed through HTTP requests to URLs like:

```curl
https://api.samsara.com/<version>/<endpoint>
```

All our APIs are [versioned](#section/Versioning). If we intend to make breaking changes to an API which either changes the response format or request parameter, we will increment the version.

# Authentication

To authenticate your API request you will need to include your secret token. You can manage your API tokens in the [Dashboard](https://cloud.samsara.com). They are visible under `Settings->Organization->API Tokens`.

Your API tokens carry many privileges, so be sure to keep them secure. Do not share your secret API tokens in publicly accessible areas such as GitHub, client-side code, and so on.

Authentication to the API is performed via [HTTP Basic Auth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication). Provide your API token as the basic access_token value in the URL. You do not need to provide a password.

```curl
https://api.samsara.com/<version>/<endpoint>?access_token={access_token}
```

All API requests must be made over [HTTPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTPS). Calls made over plain HTTP or without authentication will fail.

# Request Methods

Our API endpoints use [HTTP request methods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypertext_Transfer_Protocol#Request_methods) to specify the desired operation to be performed. The documentation below specified request method supported by each endpoint and the resulting action.

## GET

GET requests are typically used for fetching data (like data for a particular driver).

## POST

POST requests are typically used for creating or updating a record (like adding new tags to the system). With that being said, a few of our POST requests can be used for fetching data (like current location data of your fleet).

## PUT

PUT requests are typically used for updating an existing record (like updating all devices associated with a particular tag).

## PATCH

PATCH requests are typically used for modifying an existing record (like modifying a few devices associated with a particular tag).

## DELETE

DELETE requests are used for deleting a record (like deleting a tag from the system).

# Response Codes

All API requests will respond with appropriate [HTTP status code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes). Your API client should handle each response class differently.

## 2XX

These are successful responses and indicate that the API request returned the expected response.

## 4XX

These indicate that there was a problem with the request like a missing parameter or invalid values. Check the response for specific [error details](#section/Error-Responses). Requests that respond with a 4XX status code, should be modified before retrying.

## 5XX

These indicate server errors when the server is unreachable or is misconfigured. In this case, you should retry the API request after some delay.

# Error Responses

In case of a 4XX status code, the body of the response will contain information to briefly explain the error reported. To help debugging the error, you can refer to the following table for understanding the error message.

| Status Code | Message | Description |
|-------------|----------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 401 | Invalid token | The API token is invalid and could not be authenticated. Please refer to the [authentication section](#section/Authentication). |
| 404 | Page not found | The API endpoint being accessed is invalid. |
| 400 | Bad request | Default response for an invalid request. Please check the request to make sure it follows the format specified in the documentation. |

# Versioning

All our APIs are versioned. Our current API version is v1 and we are continuously working on improving it further and providing additional endpoints. If we intend to make breaking changes in a backwards-incompatible way, we release a new dated version to your API. Thus, you can use our current API version worry free. For a detailed guide on how to upgrade your API token, please check out this [Knowledge Base article](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/360026132972-Upgrading-API-Tokens).

# FAQs

Check out our [responses to FAQs here](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/sections/360000538054-APIs). Don’t see an answer to your question? Reach out to us on [support@samsara.com](mailto:support@samsara.com).
info.title: Samsara API

get.description: Fetch all addresses/geofences for the organization. An address contains either a circle or polygon geofence describing the address boundaries.

200.description: List of addresses/geofences. For each address entry, the geofence field will only be populated with either 'circle' or 'polygon', depending on the geofence type.

post.description: Add one or more addresses to the organization

200.description: List of added addresses/geofences. For each address entry, the geofence field will only be populated with either 'circle' or 'polygon', depending on the geofence type. Circle geofences added without a specific lat/lng are geocoded asynchronously, and will be 0,0 in the immediate response.

get.description: Fetch an address by its id.

parameters.description: ID of the address/geofence
parameters.name: addressId

200.description: The address/geofence. The geofence field will only be populated with either 'circle' or 'polygon', depending on the geofence type.

parameters.description: ID of the address/geofence
parameters.name: addressId

200.description: Address was successfully deleted. No response body is returned.

patch.description: Update the name, formatted address, geofence, notes, or tag and contact Ids for an address. The set of tags or contacts associated with this address will be updated to exactly match the list of IDs passed in. To remove all tags or contacts from an address, pass an empty list; to remove notes, pass an empty string.

parameters.description: ID of the address/geofence
parameters.name: addressId

200.description: Address was successfully updated. No response body is returned.

get.description: Fetch all contacts for the organization.

200.description: List of contacts.

get.description: Fetch a contact by its id.

parameters.description: ID of the contact
parameters.name: contact_id

200.description: The contact.

post.description: This method adds an address book entry to the specified group.

address.description: The address of the entry to add, as it would be recognized if provided to maps.google.com.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

name.description: Name of the location to add to the address book.

radius.description: Radius in meters of the address (used for matching vehicle trip stops to this location).

200.description: Address was successfully added. No response body is returned.

get.description: Fetch all of the assets for the group.

200.description: List of assets.

get.description: Fetch current locations of all assets for the group.

200.description: List of assets and their current locations.

get.description: Fetch the historical locations for the asset.

200.description: Asset location details.

get.description: Fetch the reefer-specific stats of an asset.

200.description: Reefer-specific asset details.

get.description: Fetch all of the dispatch routes for the group.

200.description: All dispatch route objects for the group.

post.description: Create a new dispatch route.

200.description: Created route object including the new route ID.

get.description: Fetch all updates to a job including route data in the last 24 hours or subsequent to an sequence ID. Returns a maximum of 500 job updates. If more than 500 job updates are available, another request made with the prior request's sequence_id will return the next set of available job updates.

200.description: All job updates on routes.

get.description: Fetch a dispatch route by id.

200.description: The dispatch route corresponding to route_id.

put.description: Update a dispatch route and its associated jobs.

200.description: Update the dispatch route. Allowable updates include setting job state, adding or removing jobs, and changing job locations and times.

delete.description: Delete a dispatch route and its associated jobs.

200.description: Successfully deleted the dispatch route. No response body is returned.

parameters.description: ID of the dispatch route. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: route_id

get.description: Fetch the history of a dispatch route.

parameters.description: ID of the route with history. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: route_id

200.description: The historical route state changes between start_time and end_time.

get.description: Get all the drivers for the specified group.

200.description: All drivers in the group.

post.description: Create a new driver.

200.description: Returns the successfully created the driver.

get.description: Fetch all of the document types.

200.description: Returns all of the document types.

get.description: Fetch all of the documents.

200.description: Returns all of the documents.

get.description: Fetch all deactivated drivers for the group.

200.description: Returns an array of all deactivated drivers for the group. Deactivated drivers are referenced at /fleet/drivers/inactive/{driver_id}

get.description: Fetch deactivated driver by id.

200.description: Returns the deactivated driver with the given driver_id.

put.description: Reactivate the inactive driver having id.

200.description: Returns the reactivated driver, which is now available at /fleet/drivers/{driver_id}.

get.description: Get the distance and time each driver in an organization has driven in a given time period.

parameters.description: Snap query result to HOS day boundaries.
parameters.name: snap_to_day_bounds

parameters.description: Start time (ms) of queried time period.
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: End time (ms) of queried time period. Must be greater than startMs.
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: Distance traveled and time active for each driver in the organization over the specified time period.

get.description: Fetch the safety score for the driver.

200.description: Safety score details.

parameters.description: ID of the driver. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: driverId

get.description: Fetch driver by id.

200.description: Returns the driver for the given driver_id.

delete.description: Deactivate a driver with the given id.

200.description: Successfully deactivated the driver, which is now referenced by /fleet/drivers/inactive/{driver_id}.

patch.description: Update a driver by id or by external id

200.description: Returns the updated driver.

get.description: Fetch all of the dispatch routes for a given driver.

200.description: Returns the dispatch routes for the given driver_id.

post.description: Create a new dispatch route for the driver with driver_id.

200.description: Created route object including the new route ID.

parameters.description: ID of the driver with the associated routes. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: driver_id

post.description: Create a driver document for the given driver.

200.description: Returns the created document.

parameters.description: ID of the driver for whom the document is created. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: driver_id

get.description: Fetches a single document submission by driver.

200.description: Returns the specified document.

parameters.description: ID of the driver who submitted the document. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: driver_id

parameters.description: ID of document.
parameters.name: document_id

post.description: Get summarized daily HOS charts for a specified driver.

parameters.description: ID of the driver with HOS logs.
parameters.name: driver_id

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

200.description: Distance traveled and time active for each driver in the organization over the specified time period.

get.description: Get the HOS (hours of service) signin and signout logs for the specified driver. Only signout logs include location information.

parameters.description: Driver ID to query.
parameters.name: driverId

parameters.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: HOS authentication logs for the specified driver.

post.description: Get the HOS (hours of service) logs for the specified driver. This method returns all the HOS statuses that the driver was in during this time period.

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

200.description: HOS logs for the specified driver.

get.description: Get the current HOS status for all drivers in the group.

200.description: HOS logs for the specified driver.

get.description: Get list of the vehicles. This method returns a list of the vehicles in the Samsara Cloud and information about them.

200.description: List of vehicles and information about each.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

get.description: Get current location of vehicles in a group. This method returns the current location in latitude and longitude of all vehicles in a requested group.

200.description: List of vehicle objects containing their location and the time at which that location was logged.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

get.description: Get DVIRs for the org within provided time constraints

parameters.description: time in millis until the last dvir log.
parameters.name: end_ms

parameters.description: time in millis which corresponds to the duration before the end_ms.
parameters.name: duration_ms

200.description: DVIRs for the specified duration.

post.description: Create a new dvir, marking a vehicle or trailer safe or unsafe.

200.description: Newly created DVIR.

get.description: Get list of the vehicles with any engine faults or check light data.

200.description: List of vehicles and maintenance information about each.

get.description: Get all messages.

200.description: Returns the fetched messages from most recently sent to least recently sent.

post.description: Send a message to a list of driver ids.

200.description: Returns the created messages.

post.description: This API allows you to update metadata for a single vehicle.

200.description: Vehicles were successfully updated. No response body is returned.

get.description: Fetch trailer assignment data for all trailers in your organization.

parameters.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch miliseconds representing the start of the period to fetch. Omitting both startMs and endMs only returns current assignments.
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch miliseconds representing the end of the period to fetch. Omitting endMs sets endMs as the current time
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: Returns trailer assignment data for all trailers in your organization

get.description: Fetch trailer assignment data for a single trailer.

parameters.description: ID of trailer. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: trailerId

parameters.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch milliseconds representing the start of the period to fetch. Omitting both startMs and endMs only returns current assignments.
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch milliseconds representing the end of the period to fetch. Omitting endMs sets endMs as the current time
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: Returns trailer assignment data for a single trailer

get.description:
Trips are segments of driving activity are calculated based on vehicle movement. For more information on how trips are calculated, see this [KB Article](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/227164048-How-Trips-are-Segmented). /n/n This method gets the historical trips for a specified vehicle, for the specified time range. Given these are Samsara-computed segments, these values cannot be modified by a user.

Note that trips are distinct from [unassigned drive time segments](https://kb.samsara.com/hc/en-us/articles/360007629752-Assigning-and-Annotating-Unassigned-HOS-Hours-of-Service-) for Hours of Service.

parameters.description: Vehicle ID to query.
parameters.name: vehicleId

parameters.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time. Limited to a 90 day window with respect to startMs and endMs
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.
parameters.name: endMs

200.description: List of trips taken by the requested vehicle within the specified timeframe.

get.description: Fetch locations for all vehicles between a start/end time. The maximum query duration is 30 minutes (1800000 ms).

200.description: Returns locations for all vehicles between a start/end time, with a maximum query duration of 30 minutes (1800000 ms).

parameters.description: Time in Unix epoch milliseconds for the start of the query (cannot exceed 30 minutes)
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: Time in Unix epoch milliseconds for the end of the query (cannot exceed 30 minutes)
parameters.name: endMs

get.description: Fetch engine state and aux input data for all vehicles in the group between a start/end time. This endpoint provides the current state of all vehicles, not just the state changes, during the requested time period. Data returned may be affected by device connectivity and processing time.

parameters.description: Time in Unix epoch milliseconds for the start of the query.
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: Time in Unix epoch milliseconds for the end of the query.
parameters.name: endMs

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of stat types. Options are engineState, auxInput1, and auxInput2. If this parameter is excluded, all 3 stat types will be returned. Example: series=engineState,auxInput2
parameters.name: series

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag ids. Example: tagIds=1,2,3
parameters.name: tagIds

200.description: Returns engine state and/or aux input data for all vehicles in the group between a start/end time.

externalIds.description: Dictionary of external IDs (string key-value pairs)

get.description: Fetch harsh event details for a vehicle.

200.description: Harsh event details.

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: vehicleId

get.description: Fetch the safety score for the vehicle.

200.description: Safety score details.

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: vehicleId

get.description: Gets a specific vehicle.

200.description: The specified vehicle.

patch.description: Updates the specified vehicle using JSON merge patch format. See IETF RFC 7396: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7396.

harsh_accel_setting.description:
Harsh Event Detection Setting
* 0: Passenger
* 1: Light Truck
* 2: Heavy
* 3: Off
* 4: Automatic

200.description: The updated vehicle.

get.description: Fetch all of the dispatch routes for a given vehicle.

200.description: Returns all of the dispatch routes for the given vehicle_id.

post.description: Create a new dispatch route for the vehicle with vehicle_id.

200.description: Created route object including the new route ID.

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle with the associated routes. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: vehicle_id

get.description: Fetch locations for a given vehicle between a start/end time. The maximum query duration is one hour.

200.description: Returns locations for a given vehicle between a start/end time, with a maximum query duration of one hour.

parameters.description: ID of the vehicle with the associated routes. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: vehicle_id

parameters.description: Time in Unix epoch milliseconds for the start of the query (cannot exceed 1 hour)
parameters.name: startMs

parameters.description: Time in Unix epoch milliseconds for the end of the query (cannot exceed 1 hour)
parameters.name: endMs

get.description: Fetch all of the data inputs for a group.

200.description: List of data inputs.

get.description: Fetch datapoints from a given data input.

200.description: Returns datapoints for the given data input

get.description: Fetch all cameras.

200.description: Returns details about a camera.

get.description: Fetch configured programs on the camera.

200.description: Returns programs configured on the camera.

get.description: Fetch the latest run for a camera or program by default. If startedAtMs is supplied, fetch the specific run that corresponds to that start time.

200.description: Returns the details for this run.

get.description: Fetch runs.

200.description: Return runs.

get.description: Fetch runs by camera.

200.description: Return runs by cameraId.

post.description: Get historical data for machine objects. This method returns a set of historical data for all machines in a group

parameters.description: Group ID and time range to query for events
parameters.name: historyParam

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

200.description: List of machine results objects, each containing a time and a datapoint.

post.description: Get machine objects. This method returns a list of the machine objects in the Samsara Cloud and information about them.

200.description: List of machine objects.

post.description: Get cargo monitor status (empty / full) for requested sensors.

200.description: List of sensor objects containing the current cargo status reported by each sensor.

post.description: Get door monitor status (closed / open) for requested sensors.

200.description: List of sensor objects containing the current door status reported by each sensor.

post.description: Get historical data for specified sensors. This method returns a set of historical data for the specified sensors in the specified time range and at the specified time resolution.

parameters.description: Group ID, time range and resolution, and list of sensor ID, field pairs to query.
parameters.name: historyParam

endMs.description: End of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

items.description: Sensor ID and field to query.

startMs.description: Beginning of the time range, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

stepMs.description: Time resolution for which data should be returned, in milliseconds. Specifying 3600000 will return data at hour intervals.

200.description: List of results objects, each containing a time and a datapoint for each requested sensor/field pair.

post.description: Get humidity for requested sensors. This method returns the current relative humidity for the requested sensors.

200.description: List of sensor objects containing the current humidity reported by each sensor.

post.description: Get sensor objects. This method returns a list of the sensor objects in the Samsara Cloud and information about them.

200.description: List of sensor objects.

post.description: Get temperature for requested sensors. This method returns the current ambient temperature (and probe temperature if applicable) for the requested sensors.

200.description: List of sensor objects containing the current temperature reported by each sensor.

get.description: Fetch all of the tags for a group.

200.description: List of tags.

post.description: Create a new tag for the group.

200.description: Newly created tag object, including the new tag ID.

get.description: Fetch a tag by id.

200.description: The tag corresponding to tag_id.

put.description: Update a tag with a new name and new members. This API call would replace all old members of a tag with new members specified in the request body. To modify only a few devices associated with a tag use the PATCH endpoint.

200.description: The updated tag data.
Successfully deleted the tag. No response body is returned.

patch.description: Add or delete specific members from a tag, or modify the name of a tag.

200.description: The updated tag data.

get.description: Get all roles in the organization.

200.description: List of user roles.

get.description: List all users in the organization.

200.description: List of users.

post.description: Add a user to the organization.

200.description: User successfully created.

get.description: Get a user.

parameters.description: ID of the user. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: userId

200.description: User record.

delete.description: Remove a user from the organization.

parameters.description: ID of the user. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: userId

200.description: The user was successfully removed.

patch.description: Update some fields on a user. Only fields to be changed need to be supplied. Note that if you change an object or collection, you must supply the complete collection. For example, to add a tag role to a user, you must specify all tag roles that the user should have.

parameters.description: ID of the user. Must contain only digits 0-9.
parameters.name: userId

200.description: User successfully updated.

Address.description: Information about an address/geofence. Geofences are either a circle or a polygon.

formattedAddress.description: The full address associated with this address/geofence, as it might be recognized by maps.google.com
formattedAddress.example: 350 Rhode Island St, San Francisco, CA

name.description: Name of the address or geofence

AddressGeofence.description: The geofence that defines this address and its bounds. This can either be a circle, or a polygon - only one key should be provided, depending on the geofence type.

circle.description: Information about a circular geofence. This field is only populated if the geofence is a circle.

latitude.description: The latitude of the center of the circular geofence

longitude.description: The longitude of the center of the circular geofence

radiusMeters.description: The radius of the circular geofence

polygon.description: Information about a polygon geofence. This field is only populated if the geofence is a polygon.

vertices.description: The vertices of the polygon geofence. These geofence vertices describe the perimeter of the polygon, and must consist of at least 3 vertices and less than 40.

latitude.description: The longitude of a geofence vertex

longitude.description: The longitude of a geofence vertex

assetSerialNumber.description: Serial number of the host asset

cable.description: The cable connected to the asset

latitude.description: The latitude of the location in degrees.

location.description: The best effort (street,city,state) for the latitude and longitude.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location in degrees.

speedMilesPerHour.description: The speed calculated from GPS that the asset was traveling at in miles per hour.

timeMs.description: Time in Unix milliseconds since epoch when the asset was at the location.

cable.description: The cable connected to the asset

AssetLocationResponse.description: A list of historical asset locations.

latitude.description: The latitude of the location in degrees.

location.description: The best effort (street,city,state) for the latitude and longitude.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location in degrees.

speedMilesPerHour.description: The speed calculated from GPS that the asset was traveling at in miles per hour.

time.description: Time in Unix milliseconds since epoch when the asset was at the location.

operatorAction.example: Check and repair at end of trip

severity.description: Severity of the alarm: 1: OK to run, 2: Check as specified, 3: Take immediate action

changedAtMs.description: Timestamp when the alarms were reported, in Unix milliseconds since epoch
Timestamp in Unix milliseconds since epoch.
Timestamp in Unix milliseconds since epoch.
Timestamp in Unix milliseconds since epoch.

returnAirTemp.description: Return air temperature of the reefer

changedAtMs.description: Timestamp in Unix milliseconds since epoch.

tempInMilliC.description: Return air temperature in millidegree Celsius.

setPoint.description: Set point temperature of the reefer

changedAtMs.description: Timestamp in Unix milliseconds since epoch.

tempInMilliC.description: Set point temperature in millidegree Celsius.

AuxInput.description: Digital value of an aux input.

value.description: Boolean representing the digital value of the aux input.

AuxInputSeries.description: A list of aux input values over a timerange.

name.description: The name of the aux input.

CargoResponse.description: Contains the current cargo status of a sensor.

cargoEmpty.description: Flag indicating whether the current cargo is empty or loaded.

Contact.description: Information about a notification contact for alerts.

ContactIds.description: A list of IDs for contact book entries.

id.description: The ID of this data input

points.description: Data points from this data input

arrived_at_ms.description: The time at which the driver arrived at the job destination.

completed_at_ms.description: The time at which the job was marked complete (e.g. started driving to the next destination).

dispatch_route_id.description: ID of the route that this job belongs to.

documents.description: Document submissions associated with this job.

driver_id.description: ID of the driver assigned to the dispatch job.

en_route_at_ms.description: The time at which the assigned driver started fulfilling the job (e.g. started driving to the destination).

estimated_arrival_ms.description: The time at which the assigned driver is estimated to arrive at the job destination. Only valid for en-route jobs.

fleet_viewer_url.description: Fleet viewer url of the dispatch job.

id.description: ID of the Samsara dispatch job.

skipped_at_ms.description: The time at which the job was marked skipped.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle used for the dispatch job.

destination_address.description: The address of the job destination, as it would be recognized if provided to maps.google.com. Optional if a valid destination address ID is provided.

destination_address_id.description: ID of the job destination associated with an address book entry. Optional if valid values are provided for destination address and latitude/longitude. If a valid destination address ID is provided, address/latitude/longitude will be used from the address book entry. Name of the address book entry will only be used if the destination name is not provided.

destination_lat.description: Latitude of the destination in decimal degrees. Optional if a valid destination address ID is provided.

destination_lng.description: Longitude of the destination in decimal degrees. Optional if a valid destination address ID is provided.

destination_name.description: The name of the job destination. If provided, it will take precedence over the name of the address book entry.

notes.description: Notes regarding the details of this job.
notes.example: Ensure crates are stacked no more than 3 high.

scheduled_arrival_time_ms.description: The time at which the assigned driver is scheduled to arrive at the job destination.

scheduled_departure_time_ms.description: The time at which the assigned driver is scheduled to depart from the job destination.

driverId.description: ID of driver that submitted the document.

id.description: ID of document. This can be used to query for the document's info via the /v1/fleet/drivers/{driver_id}/documents/{document_id} endpoint
ID of the Samsara dispatch job to update

dispatch_jobs.description: The dispatch jobs associated with this route.

id.description: ID of the Samsara dispatch route.

actual_end_ms.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the route actually ended.

actual_start_ms.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the route actually started.

driver_id.description: ID of the driver assigned to the dispatch route. Note that driver_id and vehicle_id are mutually exclusive. If neither is specified, then the route is unassigned.

group_id.description: ID of the group if the organization has multiple groups (optional).

odometer_end_meters.description: Odometer reading at the end of the route. Will not be returned if Route is not completed or if Odometer information is not available for the relevant vehicle.

odometer_start_meters.description: Odometer reading at the start of the route. Will not be returned if Route has not started or if Odometer information is not available for the relevant vehicle.

scheduled_end_ms.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the last job in the route is scheduled to end.

scheduled_meters.description: The distance expected to be traveled for this route in meters.

scheduled_start_ms.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the route is scheduled to start.

start_location_address.description: The address of the route's starting location, as it would be recognized if provided to maps.google.com. Optional if a valid start location address ID is provided.

start_location_address_id.description: ID of the start location associated with an address book entry. Optional if valid values are provided for start location address and latitude/longitude. If a valid start location address ID is provided, address/latitude/longitude will be used from the address book entry. Name of the address book entry will only be used if the start location name is not provided.

start_location_lat.description: Latitude of the start location in decimal degrees. Optional if a valid start location address ID is provided.

start_location_lng.description: Longitude of the start location in decimal degrees. Optional if a valid start location address ID is provided.

start_location_name.description: The name of the route's starting location. If provided, it will take precedence over the name of the address book entry.

trailer_id.description: ID of the trailer assigned to the dispatch route. Note that trailers can only be assigned to routes that have a Vehicle or Driver assigned to them.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle assigned to the dispatch route. Note that vehicle_id and driver_id are mutually exclusive. If neither is specified, then the route is unassigned.

dispatch_jobs.description: The dispatch jobs to create for this route.

driver_id.description: ID of the driver assigned to the dispatch route. Note that driver_id and vehicle_id are mutually exclusive. If neither is specified, then the route is unassigned.

group_id.description: ID of the group if the organization has multiple groups (optional).

scheduled_end_ms.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the last job in the route is scheduled to end.

scheduled_meters.description: The distance expected to be traveled for this route in meters.

scheduled_start_ms.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the route is scheduled to start.

start_location_address.description: The address of the route's starting location, as it would be recognized if provided to maps.google.com. Optional if a valid start location address ID is provided.

start_location_address_id.description: ID of the start location associated with an address book entry. Optional if valid values are provided for start location address and latitude/longitude. If a valid start location address ID is provided, address/latitude/longitude will be used from the address book entry. Name of the address book entry will only be used if the start location name is not provided.

start_location_lat.description: Latitude of the start location in decimal degrees. Optional if a valid start location address ID is provided.

start_location_lng.description: Longitude of the start location in decimal degrees. Optional if a valid start location address ID is provided.

start_location_name.description: The name of the route's starting location. If provided, it will take precedence over the name of the address book entry.

trailer_id.description: ID of the trailer assigned to the dispatch route. Note that trailers can only be assigned to routes that have a Vehicle or Driver assigned to them.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle assigned to the dispatch route. Note that vehicle_id and driver_id are mutually exclusive. If neither is specified, then the route is unassigned.

changed_at_ms.description: Timestamp that the route was updated, represented as Unix milliseconds since epoch.

history.description: History of the route's state changes.

dispatch_jobs.description: The dispatch jobs for the route.

id.description: ID of route. This must match the route ID passed in URL.

documentType.description: Descriptive name of this type of document.

driverCreatedAtMs.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the document is created.

driverId.description: ID of the driver for whom the document is submitted

fields.description: The fields associated with this document.

orgId.description: Organization ID that the document & driver who submitted the doc belongs to

vehicleId.description: VehicleID of the driver at document creation.

dispatchJobId.description: ID of the Samsara dispatch job for which the document is submitted

documentTypeUuid.description: Universally unique identifier for the document type this document is being created for.

fields.description: List of fields and associated values for a given document. The fields must be listed in the order that that they appear in the specificied document type. Today `stringValue` and `numberValue` are the two supported document upload field types.

dispatchJobId.description: ID of the Samsara dispatch job for which the document is submitted

allOf.description: A field of a document. A field can be a string type, number type, or photo type, which can be identified from its valueType. Between stringValue, numberValue, and photoValue, only one can exist for a single document field depending on the valueType.

value.description: DEPRECATED: Please use stringValue, numberValue, or photoValue instead. Value of this field. Depending on what kind of field it is, this may be one of the following: an array of image urls, a float, an integer, or a string.

multipleChoiceValue.description: Value of this field if this document field has valueType: ValueType_MultipleChoice. Array of objects containing two fields: the string value of the multiple choice option and a boolean representing whether or not the choice was selected

numberValue.description: Value of this field if this document field has valueType: ValueType_Number.

photoValue.description: Value of this field if this document field has valueType: ValueType_Photo. Array of photo objects where each object contains a URL for a photo.

url.description: Photo URL for a JPG image

stringValue.description: Value of this field if this document field has valueType: ValueType_String.

valueType.description: Determines the type of this field and what type of value this field has. It should be either ValueType_Number, ValueType_String, or ValueType_Photo.

label.description: Descriptive name of this field type.

numberValueTypeMetadata.description: Additional metadata information for a number field type. Only defined when a field type has valueType: ValueType_Number.

numDecimalPlaces.description: Number of decimal places that values for this field type can have.

valueType.description: The kind of value that can be submitted for this fieldType. It should be either ValueType_Number, ValueType_String, or ValueType_Photo.

fieldTypes.description: The field types determine the names of fields for this document type. They also determine the types of values a document submitted for this document type can have.

orgId.description: ID for the organization this document belongs to.

uuid.description: Universally unique identifier for the document type. Can be passed in as a documentTypeUuid when creating a document for this document type.

DoorResponse.description: Contains the current door status of a sensor.

doorClosed.description: Flag indicating whether the current door is closed or open.

isDeactivated.description: True if the driver account has been deactivated.

currentVehicleId.description: ID of the vehicle that this driver is currently assigned to. Omitted if there is no current vehicle assignment for this driver.

eldAdverseWeatherExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Adverse Weather exemptions in ELD logs.

eldBigDayExemptionEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may use Big Day excemptions in ELD logs.

eldDayStartHour.description: 0 indicating midnight-to-midnight ELD driving hours, 12 to indicate noon-to-noon driving hours.

eldExempt.description: Flag indicating this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate.

eldExemptReason.description: Reason that this driver is exempt from the Electronic Logging Mandate (see eldExempt).

eldPcEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Personal Conveyance duty status in ELD logs.

eldYmEnabled.description: Flag indicating this driver may select the Yard Move duty status in ELD logs.

externalIds.description: Dictionary of external IDs (string key-value pairs)

groupId.description: ID of the group if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

licenseState.description: Abbreviation of state that issued driver's license.

notes.example: Also goes by the nickname 'Furious Fred'.

phone.description: Driver's phone number. Please include only digits, ex. 4157771234

username.description: Driver's login username into the driver app.

vehicleId.description: ID of the vehicle assigned to the driver for static vehicle assignments. (uncommon).

activeHours.description: Hours spent on duty or driving, rounded to two decimal places.

activeMs.description: Milliseconds spent on duty or driving.

certified.description: Whether this HOS day chart was certified by the driver.

certifiedAtMs.description: Unix epoch time (in ms) of time when this chart was certified. If this chart is uncertified, 0.

distanceMiles.description: Distance driven in miles, rounded to two decimal places.

endMs.description: End of the HOS day, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

startMs.description: End of the HOS day, specified in milliseconds UNIX time.

trailerIds.description: List of trailer ID's associated with the driver for the day.

vehicleIds.description: List of vehicle ID's associated with the driver for the day.

password.description: Driver's password for the driver app.

DriverSafetyScoreResponse.description: Safety score details for a driver

timeOverSpeedLimitMs.description: Amount of time driven over the speed limit in milliseconds

totalTimeDrivenMs.description: Amount of time driven in milliseconds

activeMs.description: Duration in milliseconds that driver was on duty or driving during the requested time range

distanceMiles.description: Distance driven in miles, rounded to two decimal places.

driveMs.description: Duration in milliseconds that driver was driving during the requested time range

onDutyMs.description: Duration in milliseconds that driver was on duty during the requested time range

authorSignature.description: The authors signature for the DVIR.

driverId.description: ID of the driver who signed the DVIR. Will not be returned if mechanicUserId is returned.

email.description: Email of the  driver|mechanic who signed the DVIR.

mechanicUserId.description: ID of the mechanic who signed the DVIR. Will not be returned if driverId is returned.

name.description: The name of the driver or mechanic who signed the DVIR.

signedAt.description: The time in millis when the DVIR was signed

type.description: Type corresponds to whether the signature corresponds to driver|mechanic.

username.description: Username of the  driver|mechanic who signed the DVIR.

defectsCorrected.description: Signifies if the defects on the vehicle corrected after the DVIR is done.

defectsNeedNotBeCorrected.description: Signifies if the defects on this vehicle can be ignored.

id.description: The id of this DVIR record.

mechanicNotes.description: The mechanics notes on the DVIR.

mechanicOrAgentSignature.description: The mechanic's or agent's signature for the DVIR.

driverId.description: ID of the driver who signed the DVIR. Will not be returned if mechanicUserId is returned.

email.description: Email of the  agent|mechanic who signed the DVIR.

mechanicUserId.description: ID of the mechanic who signed the DVIR. Will not be returned if driverId is returned.

name.description: The name of the agent or mechanic who signed the DVIR.

signedAt.description: The time in millis when the DVIR was signed

type.description: Type corresponds to whether the signature corresponds to driver|mechanic.

username.description: Username of the  agent|mechanic who signed the DVIR.

nextDriverSignature.description: The next driver signature for the DVIR.

driverId.description: ID of the driver who signed the DVIR

email.description: Email of the  driver who signed the next DVIR on this vehicle.

name.description: The name of the driver who signed the next DVIR on this vehicle.

signedAt.description: The time in millis when the next driver signed the DVIR on this vehicle.

username.description: Username of the  driver who signed the next DVIR on this vehicle.

odometerMiles.description: The odometer reading in miles for the vehicle when the DVIR was done.

timeMs.description: Timestamp of this DVIR in UNIX milliseconds.

trailerDefects.description: Defects registered for the trailer which was part of the DVIR.

comment.description: The comment describing the type of DVIR defect

trailerId.description: The id of the trailer which was part of the DVIR.

trailerName.description: The name of the trailer which was part of the DVIR.

vehicle.description: The vehicle on which DVIR was done.

id.description: The vehicle id on which DVIR was done.

name.description: The vehicle on which DVIR was done.

vehicleCondition.description: The condition of vechile on which DVIR was done.

vehicleDefects.description: Defects registered for the vehicle which was part of the DVIR.

comment.description: The comment describing the type of DVIR defect

EngineState.description: The state of the vehicle over time. State can be Running, Off, or Idle.

ErrorResponse.description: Error message describing why the request failed.

FleetVehicleLocation.description: Contains the location and speed of a vehicle at a particular time

latitude.description: The latitude of the location in degrees.

location.description: The best effort (street,city,state) for the latitude and longitude.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location in degrees.

speedMilesPerHour.description: The speed calculated from GPS that the asset was traveling at in miles per hour.

timeMs.description: Time in Unix milliseconds since epoch when the asset was at the location.

FleetVehicleResponse.description: A vehicle object as returned for fleet/vehicle

actionType.description: The log type - one of 'signin' or 'signout'

address.description: Address at which the log was recorded, if applicable.

addressName.description: Address name from the group address book at which the log was recorded, if applicable.

city.description: City in which the log was recorded, if applicable.

happenedAtMs.description: The time at which the event was recorded in UNIX milliseconds.

state.description: State in which the log was recorded, if applicable.

items.description: Ids of codrivers during any of the logged trips

locCity.description: City in which the log was recorded.

locLat.description: Latitude at which the log was recorded.

locLng.description: Longitude at which the log was recorded.

locName.description: Name of location at which the log was recorded.

locState.description: State in which the log was recorded.

logStartMs.description: The time at which the log/HOS status started in UNIX milliseconds.

remark.description: Remark associated with the log entry.

statusType.description: The Hours of Service status type. One of `OFF_DUTY`, `SLEEPER_BED`, `DRIVING`, `ON_DUTY`, `YARD_MOVE`, `PERSONAL_CONVEYANCE`.

cycleRemaining.description: The amount of remaining cycle time (in ms).

cycleTomorrow.description: The amount of cycle time (in ms) available tomorrow.

drivingInViolationCycle.description: The amount of driving time in violation in this cycle (in ms).

drivingInViolationToday.description: The amount of driving time in violation today (in ms).

dutyStatus.description: The Hours of Service status type. One of `OFF_DUTY`, `SLEEPER_BED`, `DRIVING`, `ON_DUTY`, `YARD_MOVE`, `PERSONAL_CONVEYANCE`.

shiftDriveRemaining.description: The amount of remaining shift drive time (in ms).

shiftRemaining.description: The amount of remaining shift time (in ms).

timeInCurrentStatus.description: The amount of time (in ms) that the driver has been in the current `dutyStatus`.

timeUntilBreak.description: The amount of time (in ms) remaining until the driver cannot drive without a rest break.

HumidityResponse.description: Contains the current humidity of a sensor.

humidity.description: Currently reported relative humidity in percent, from 0-100.

notes.example: This is in the left hallway behind the conveyor belt

MachineHistoryResponse.description: Contains the results for a machine history request

vibrations.description: List of vibration datapoints, with timestamp and vibration measurement for x/y/z axis in mm/s

driverId.description: ID of the driver for whom the message is sent to or sent by.

text.description: The text sent in the message.

driverId.description: ID of the driver for whom the message is sent to or sent by.

isRead.description: True if the message was read by the recipient.

sentAtMs.description: The time in Unix epoch milliseconds that the message is sent to the recipient.

text.description: The text sent in the message.

name.description: Name of user that is sending the message.

type.description: Type of user that is sending the message. It will be either dispatch or driver.

endCursor.description: Cursor identifier representing the last element in the response. This value should be used in conjunction with a subsequent request's 'starting_after' query parameter.

hasNextPage.description: True if there are more pages of results after this response.

hasPrevPage.description: True if there are more pages of results before this response.

startCursor.description: Cursor identifier representing the first element in the response. This value should be used in conjunction with a subsequent request's 'ending_before' query parameter.

ProgramsForTheCameraResponse.description: Contains the list of Programs configured on the given Camera.

timestampMs.description: Timestamp that the harsh event occurred in Unix milliseconds since epoch

vehicleId.description: Vehicle associated with the harsh event

SensorHistoryResponse.description: Contains the results for a sensor history request. Each result contains a timestamp and datapoint for each requested (sensor, field) pair.

series.description: List of datapoints, one for each requested (sensor, field) pair.

TemperatureResponse.description: Contains the current temperatures of a sensor.

ambientTemperature.description: Currently reported ambient temperature in millidegrees celsius.

probeTemperature.description: Currently reported probe temperature in millidegrees celsius. If no probe is connected, this parameter will not be reported.

driverId.description: The ID of the driver associated with this trailer.

endMs.description: The time at which the driver ended the assignment. If the assignment is current, this value will be omitted.

startMs.description: The time at which the driver started the assignment

name.description: Assignment trailer name (given when creating trailer via the trailer portal)

TripResponse.description: Contains the trips for the vehicle in the requested timeframe. A trip is represented as an object that contains startMs, startLocation, startAddress, startCoordinates, endMs, endLocation, endAddress and endCoordinates.

distanceMeters.description: Length of the trip in meters.

endAddress.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to the end (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

endLocation.description: Geocoded street address of start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

endMs.description: End of the trip in UNIX milliseconds.

endOdometer.description: Odometer reading (in meters) at the end of the trip.

fuelConsumedMl.description: Amount in milliliters of fuel consumed on this trip.

startAddress.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to the start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

startLocation.description: Geocoded street address of start (latitude, longitude) coordinates.
startLocation.example: 16 N Fair Oaks Ave, Pasadena, CA 91103

startMs.description: Beginning of the trip in UNIX milliseconds.

startOdometer.description: Odometer reading (in meters) at the beginning of the trip.

tollMeters.description: Length in meters trip spent on toll roads.

authType.description: The authentication type the user uses to authenticate. To use SAML this organization must have a configured SAML integration.

name.description: The first and last name of the user.

organizationRoleId.description: The id of the role the user is assigned to at the organization level. This will be blank for users that only have access to specific tags.

tagRoles.description: If specified, the user will be an administrator for these tags. If left blank, the user has access to the entire organization.

tagId.description: The id of the tag to grant this user access to.

id.description: The ID of the User record.

organizationRole.description: The name of the role the user is assigned to at the organization level. This will be blank for users that only have access to specific tags.

tagRoles.description: The specific tags this user has access to. This will be blank for users that have full access to the organization.

authType.description: The authentication type the user uses to authenticate. To use SAML this organization must have a configured SAML integration.

email.description: The email address of this user.

name.description: The first and last name of the user.

organizationRoleId.description: The id of the role the user is assigned to at the organization level. This will be blank for users that only have access to specific tags.

role.description: The name of the role the user has been granted on this tag.

roleId.description: The id of the role the user has been granted on this tag.

engineHours.description: Total engine hours for the vehicle.

fuelLevelPercent.description: The fuel level of the vehicle as a percentage. (0.0 to 1.0)

odometerMeters.description: The number of meters reported by the odometer.

VehicleHarshEventResponse.description: Harsh event details for a vehicle

downloadForwardVideoUrl.description: URL for downloading the forward facing video

downloadInwardVideoUrl.description: URL for downloading the inward facing video

downloadTrackedInwardVideoUrl.description: URL for downloading the tracked inward facing video

harshEventType.description: Type of the harsh event. One of: [Crash, Harsh Acceleration, Harsh Braking, Harsh Turn, ROP Engine, ROP Brake, YC Engine, YC Brake, Harsh Event]

incidentReportUrl.description: URL of the associated incident report page

isDistracted.description: Whether the driver was deemed distracted during this harsh event

address.description: Address of location where the harsh event occurred
address.example: 350 Rhode Island St, San Francisco, CA

latitude.description: Latitude of location where the harsh event occurred

longitude.description: Longitude of location where the harsh event occurred

VehicleLocation.description: Contains the location, in latitude and longitude, of a vehicle.

driverId.description: The ID of the driver currently assigned to this vehicle.

location.description: Text representation of nearest identifiable location to (latitude, longitude) coordinates.

odometerMeters.description: The number of meters reported by the odometer.

onTrip.description: Whether or not a trip is currently in progress for this vehicle. More information available via /fleet/trips endpoint.

routeIds.description: A list of currently active route IDs that the vehicle is in.

time.description: The time the reported location was logged, reported as a UNIX timestamp in milliseconds.

vin.description: Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) of the vehicle.

VehicleMaintenance.description: Contains any J1939/Passenger engine light warnings and engine faults.

j1939.description: J1939 based data. Null if no data is available.

passenger.description: Passenger vehicle data. Null if no data is available.

VehicleSafetyScoreResponse.description: Safety score details for a vehicle

timeOverSpeedLimitMs.description: Amount of time driven over the speed limit in milliseconds

totalTimeDrivenMs.description: Amount of time driven in milliseconds

VisionCamerasResponse.description: Contains the list of Cameras installed in the org.

sequence_id.description: Sequence ID of the last update returned in the response

jobStatus.description: The current state of the dispatch job.

changed_at_ms.description: Timestamp that this event was updated, represented as Unix milliseconds since epoch.

route_id.description: ID of the Samsara dispatch route.

prevJobStatus.description: The previous state of the dispatch job.

addressAddParam.description:
List of addresses/geofences to add. Geofences can be circular or a polygon. 
For each address, only one of 'circle' or 'polygon' should be provided. If both are provided, the geofence will be saved as a polygon.
addressAddParam.name: addresses

formattedAddress.description: The full address associated with this address/geofence, as it might be recognized by maps.google.com
formattedAddress.example: 350 Rhode Island St, San Francisco, CA

addressUpdateParam.description: Update parts of an address's value. If the geofence 'circle' or 'polygon' key is specified, the update will change the type of geofence accordingly.
addressUpdateParam.name: address

formattedAddress.description: The full address associated with this address/geofence, as it might be recognized by maps.google.com
formattedAddress.example: 350 Rhode Island St, San Francisco, CA

assetHistoryEndTimeParam.description: Timestamp in milliseconds representing the end of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with startMs.
assetHistoryEndTimeParam.name: endMs

assetHistoryStartTimeParam.description: Timestamp in milliseconds representing the start of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with endMs.
assetHistoryStartTimeParam.name: startMs

assetIdParam.description: ID of the asset. Must contain only digits 0-9.
assetIdParam.name: asset_id

odometerMiles.description: The current odometer of the vehicle.

previousDefectsCorrected.description: Whether any previous defects were corrected. If this vehicle or trailer was previously marked unsafe, and this DVIR marks it as safe, either previousDefectsCorrected or previousDefectsIgnored must be true.

previousDefectsIgnored.description: Whether any previous defects were ignored. If this vehicle or trailer was previously marked unsafe, and this DVIR marks it as safe, either previousDefectsCorrected or previousDefectsIgnored must be true.

safe.description: Whether or not this vehicle or trailer is safe to drive.

trailerId.description: Id of trailer being inspected. Either vehicleId or trailerId must be provided.

userEmail.description: The Samsara login email for the person creating the DVIR. The email must correspond to a Samsara user's email.

vehicleId.description: Id of vehicle being inspected. Either vehicleId or trailerId must be provided.

createMessagesParam.description: Text to send to a list of driverIds.
createMessagesParam.name: createMessages

driverIds.description: IDs of the drivers for whom the messages are sent to.

text.description: The text sent in the message.

createUserParam.description: User properties. Only one of organizationRoleId or tagRoles is required.
createUserParam.name: user

email.description: The email address of this user.

dataInputEndTimeParam.description: Timestamp in unix milliseconds representing the end of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with startMs. Defaults to nowMs.
dataInputEndTimeParam.name: endMs

dataInputIdParam.description: ID of the data input. Must contain only digits 0-9.
dataInputIdParam.name: data_input_id

dataInputStartTimeParam.description: Timestamp in unix milliseconds representing the start of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with endMs. defaults to nowMs.
dataInputStartTimeParam.name: startMs

documentCreateParam.description: To create a document for a given document type, the document type's uuid needs to be passed in to documentTypeUuid. The list of fields passed in should match the document type’s list of field types in the correct order. In other words, a field's valueType and value (i.e. only one of: stringValue, numberValue, or photoValue) at index _i_ should match with the document field type’s valueType at index _i_.
documentCreateParam.name: createDocumentParams

documentsDurationMsParam.description: Time in milliseconds that represents the duration before endMs to query. Defaults to 24 hours.
documentsDurationMsParam.name: durationMs

documentsEndMsParam.description: Time in unix milliseconds that represents the oldest documents to return. Used in combination with durationMs. Defaults to now.
documentsEndMsParam.name: endMs

driverIdOrExternalIdParam.description: ID of the driver.  This must be either the numeric ID generated by Samsara or the external ID of the driver. Driver ID must contain only digits 0-9. External IDs are customer specified key-value pairs and must contain only alphanumeric characters.
driverIdOrExternalIdParam.name: driver_id_or_external_id

getMessagesDurationMsParam.description: Time in milliseconds that represents the duration before endMs to query. Defaults to 24 hours.
getMessagesDurationMsParam.name: durationMs

getMessagesEndMsParam.description: Time in unix milliseconds that represents the end of time range of messages to return. Used in combination with durationMs. Defaults to now.
getMessagesEndMsParam.name: endMs

groupIdBodyParam.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
groupIdBodyParam.name: groupIdBodyParam

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

groupIdParam.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
groupIdParam.name: group_id

groupIdQueryParam.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).
groupIdQueryParam.name: groupId

harshEventMsParam.description: Timestamp in milliseconds representing the timestamp of a harsh event.
harshEventMsParam.name: timestamp

jobUpdatesIncludeParam.description: Optionally set include=route to include route object in response payload.
jobUpdatesIncludeParam.name: include

lastReceivedSequenceIDParam.description: Sequence ID from the response payload of the last request. Defaults to fetching updates from last 24 hours.
lastReceivedSequenceIDParam.name: sequence_id

paginationEndingBeforeParam.description: Pagination parameter indicating the cursor position to return results before. Used in conjunction with the 'limit' parameter. Mutually exclusive with 'startingAfter' parameter.
paginationEndingBeforeParam.name: endingBefore

paginationLimitParam.description: Pagination parameter indicating the number of results to return in this request. Used in conjunction with either 'startingAfter' or 'endingBefore'.
paginationLimitParam.name: limit

paginationStartingAfterParam.description: Pagination parameter indicating the cursor position to continue returning results after. Used in conjunction with the 'limit' parameter. Mutually exclusive with 'endingBefore' parameter.
paginationStartingAfterParam.name: startingAfter

reactivate.description: True indicates that this driver should be reactivated.

routeDurationParam.description: Time in milliseconds that represents the duration before end_time to query. Defaults to 24 hours.
routeDurationParam.name: duration

routeEndTimeParam.description: Time in unix milliseconds that represents the oldest routes to return. Used in combination with duration. Defaults to now.
routeEndTimeParam.name: end_time

routeHistoryEndTimeParam.description: Timestamp representing the end of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with start_time. Defaults to nowMs.
routeHistoryEndTimeParam.name: end_time

routeHistoryStartTimeParam.description: Timestamp representing the start of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with end_time. Defaults to 0.
routeHistoryStartTimeParam.name: start_time

safetyScoreEndMsParam.description: Timestamp in milliseconds representing the end of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with startMs.
safetyScoreEndMsParam.name: endMs

safetyScoreStartMsParam.description: Timestamp in milliseconds representing the start of the period to fetch, inclusive. Used in combination with endMs.
safetyScoreStartMsParam.name: startMs

sensorParam.description: Group ID and list of sensor IDs to query.
sensorParam.name: sensorParam

groupId.description: Optional group ID if the organization has multiple groups (uncommon).

sensors.description: List of sensor IDs to query.

tagPathParam.description: ID of the tag. Must contain only digits 0-9.
tagPathParam.name: tag_id

updateUserParam.description: User properties. Note that when updating tagRoles, the complete list of tag roles must be supplied for the user. To delete all tag roles set the value to null or an empty array.
updateUserParam.name: user

vehicleIdOrExternalIdParam.description: ID of the vehicle.  This must be either the numeric ID generated by Samsara or the external ID of the vehicle. Vehicle ID must contain only digits 0-9. External IDs are customer specified key-value pairs and must contain only alphanumeric characters.
vehicleIdOrExternalIdParam.name: vehicle_id_or_external_id

visionCameraIdParam.description: The camera_id should be valid for the given accessToken.
visionCameraIdParam.name: camera_id

visionDurationMsParam.description: DurationMs is a required param. This works with the EndMs parameter. Indicates the duration in which the visionRuns will be fetched
visionDurationMsParam.name: durationMs

visionEndMsParam.description: EndMs is an optional param. It will default to the current time.
visionEndMsParam.name: endMs

visionIncludeParam.description: Include is a filter parameter. Accepts 'pass', 'reject' or 'no_read'.
visionIncludeParam.name: include

visionLimitParam.description: Limit is an integer value from 1 to 1,000.
visionLimitParam.name: limit

visionProgramIdParam.description: The configured program's ID on the camera.
visionProgramIdParam.name: program_id

visionStartAtMsParam.description: EndMs is an optional param. It will default to the current time.
visionStartAtMsParam.name: startedAtMs

tags.name: Drivers
tags.description:
`Driver` objects allow you to track your driver-vehicle assignments, manage driver profiles, and update mobile app credential logins. You can retrieve a list of all drivers, or you can fetch each driver object individually.

 Drivers can be either `active` or `inactive`. You should inactivate a driver if you wish to keep the driver's driving history and HOS logs. If your driver is inactive,  you can still get information about a driver summary.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: A `user` refers to an individual who can log in to the Samsara administrator dashboard. The users API is particularly useful in updating roles and permissions for a given user based on configurations within an identity provider (IdP).
